# President of Central Philippine University

The following is a list of presidents of Central Philippine University from its founding in 1905 up to the present. The president is required by the university to be of the Baptist or any Protestant denomination:

|1. 90px || Reverend William Valentine || 1862–1928 || 1905–1906; 1907–1914 || Established a Bible School in the City of Iloilo (June 1905) and later the Jaro Industrial School (1905). Women were admitted to the Jaro Industrial School (1913). Both schools were founded after the succession of the Philippines from Spain to the United States through the Treaty of Paris (1898).

|-
|14. 120px || Rex Divinagracia Drilon || - || 1966–1971 || The first Filipino and alum to be president (1966). The Filipinization of Central where the university properties was turned over by the American Baptist Foreign Mission Society to the Filipinos (1968)
|-
